website_summaries.verdict: A top pick for a motor oil filter that has an emphasis on high performance engines.
pros: Wide variety of compatible engines including sports cars, trucks, sedans, SUVs, and even ATVs
Heavy-duty construction is great for more challenging and dirty driving conditions
cons: Parts of the filter are difficult to grasp onto with a wrench

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit.
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit 2014 Bmw K1600gtl. The knob hits the shifter. Sham on me waiting until last minute and trying aftermarket product. Headed to BMW dealer to get right filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I've never had an issue with any K&N filters and I love how they have last a long time between oil change intervals. The nut welded to the bottom has always been a benefit to any Canon filter for those who have used them before. This particular filter was great for my 2009 BMW R 1200 RT- p
customer_reviews.author: DunkelRabe

customer_reviews.title: I think I bought the wrong one, but its on the bike and working (R1150GS)
customer_reviews.text: So I guess I hit the purchase button too soon because it did not specify my BMW (R1150GS), but it seems to fit and there is no strange noises. It just seems to be smaller in height than the normal filter.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carr

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: great value if you have a 2008 k1200 gt that needs the short filter this is the one you want not the 160
customer_reviews.author: zoom zoom

customer_reviews.title: Better than stock oil filter
customer_reviews.text: Very nice oil filter for my 2007 BMW K1200GT. Perfect size, and the built in lug nut on the end is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: The 17mm nut makes this an easy filter to install at the proper torque spec & easy to remove. This filter meets or exceeds the OEM specs for mu BMW motorcycles. Cheaper than OEM filters.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Solid option for 09 R1200GS
customer_reviews.text: Less expensive then the dealership/BMW branded filter and the bolt on the casing makes it easy to change without a special tool.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: BMW K1600 GTL does not fit.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not fit the BMW K1600 GTL as advertised. the nut on top of the filter interferes with the shift lever. Shame on K&N. it says it will fit on their web site.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Hulsey

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit on a K1600
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this item. For the first time in my life I did an oil change and left the prior oil filter in place. Upon installing the K&N filter I went to reattach the gear shift level only to discover the nut welded to the outside of the filter blocks the gear shift level. So if you enjoy shifting out of first gear when you ride, don't buy this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit K1600gtl
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my K1600gtl BMW -the Nut built into the case for removal interferes with the Shifter. Could not change gears. It is about 3⁄4" too tall for the bike
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sloggatt

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2014 BMW r1200RT (wethead)
customer_reviews.text: They changed the product number since last time I purchased one, but this is definitely the one for the R1200 wetheads. I love the easy wrench off design (but only hand tighten it on)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best value for money
customer_reviews.text: Been using this oil filter for past 7 yrs on my R1200GS. Hands down best value for money. Socket makes easily accessible below the engine.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: K&N has always delivered
customer_reviews.text: I use K&N for all my needs on both cars and motorcycles. There is nothing you can really look at and say WOW this is great other than the nifty and simple approach to removing a used filter that i think is unique to K&N (likely patented). However, i have read multiple reviews from engineering types whom have dissected filters and come to the conclusion that S&H has far more "filtering" capacity and ability than brands more typically sold and cheaper (like Fram). Im a believer in high quality and these seem to deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rider

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Does NOT fit BMW K1600
customer_reviews.text: This filter does NOT, I repeat, does NOT fit the BMW K1600. The extended hex nut interferes with the shifter. You can not use this filter on the K1600!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit K1600
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. Does not go with 2014 K1600 GTL. The nut rubs against the shifter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerstephen kujawa

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 2012 BMW R1200RT. Quality filter , cheaper than oem. Have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Penney

customer_reviews.title: Probably not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Had to file down the wrench but due to gear shift hitting it. Annoying
customer_reviews.author: Kara Ludlow

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT 2009 R1200GS!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon claimed that it would fit my R1200GS that I have in my 'garage'. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: I. MCDOUGALL

customer_reviews.title: does not fit 2012 BMW K1600 GTL
customer_reviews.text: K&N makes a great product. Unfortunately, this filter did not fit my 2012 BMW K1600 GTL correctly. The nut on top is too tall. If the nut was half height, it would work much better. I had to shim out the shift lever so it would clear the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Scarfo

customer_reviews.title: Great oil filter
customer_reviews.text: I have used these filters over several years on my motorcycle. I've never had an issue with any. Will continue to buy. The nut is super helpful in removing the filter for oil changes.
customer_reviews.author: Unreal McCoy

customer_reviews.title: BMW r1200gs
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good alternative for my 2005 r1200gs.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: My favorite filter for all my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: The attached nut makes the K&N filters my favorite choices. Of course, K&N makes a high quality, high flow filter that is just at home on the street or in the track, but the ease of just using an everyday socket makes removal and installation a breeze. Also, much less mess without having oil pour all over your hands. This one is installed on my 2012 BMW S1000RR. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkelface

customer_reviews.title: Great oil filter for the money
customer_reviews.text: love this oil filter and no leaks so far on my Motorcycle
customer_reviews.author: ZurvitaSuperstore

customer_reviews.title: Interferes with your gear lever
customer_reviews.text: I cannot put my bike into any higher gear. Had to dump it and go with the original. Not sure why they say in the description that it fits the BMW K1600 GTL. Need to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit BMW K...
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit a BMW K1600 as advertised. Their 17MM nut interfears with shifter motion for upshifts.
customer_reviews.author: Maryfrances D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: Great product and I love how easy it is to get a wrench on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: BMW and K&N great combo!
customer_reviews.text: On a bmw what better way to remove the filter than a socket!!! Better than the special tool
customer_reviews.author: Jason Reed

customer_reviews.title: WON'T FIT BMW K1600 - despite K&N application chart.
customer_reviews.text: K&N claims this filter fits the BMW K1600 motorcycle. It does NOT! The filter can is the correct size, but the hex nut on top of the can obstructs movement of the motorcycle's shift lever - making it unusable in that application. DO NOT buy this filter for a BMW K1600 motorcycle!
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Convient
customer_reviews.text: Love these filters. The nut on the end makes it nice. I like not having to use a filter wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad for for K1600!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good filter for the k1600 gtl. The hex head protruded too far and interfered with the gear shift toggle bar. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Oil Filter for R1200GS Adventure
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of K&N filters. The hex drive on the bottom aids installation and removal. No special tools required - just a wrench or socket. I make my change interval @ 5000 miles. Factory recommends 6000 miles but I'm a bit conservative on that. My Castrol oil appears to be cleaner on drain-out with this mileage.
customer_reviews.author: prototypecycle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have not installed yet but like the idea of a normal wrench to install.
customer_reviews.author: T.R.S.

customer_reviews.title: BMW i3 rex
customer_reviews.text: This fits all BMW i3 rex. No problem. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: win911

customer_reviews.title: K&N Oil Filter for BMW f650gs 800cc twin
customer_reviews.text: I use K&N on all of my vehicles. Besides their great quality, I have always liked that the products are made in the USA. This filter is made in Thailand. That's OK, but for the price, I would expect made in USA for sure. I like they way they invented the welded on nut on the housing to make the filter easy to install and remove with normal tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Curl aka RedonKiLaus

customer_reviews.title: All Good
customer_reviews.text: This is the filter you need for your 05 R12 GS, shorty type giving clearance for your bash plate
customer_reviews.author: Sanford Gentry

customer_reviews.title: KN-164 Oil Filter
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these filters for my BMW for about a year now. I noticed the latest shipment came directly from K&N and to my chagrin the filters are now made in China. They look to be awesome quality, but I plan to return to BMW filters because they are made in Austria and I trust their quality control much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Curl aka RedonKiLaus

customer_reviews.title: ... 2014 S1000RR without a problem and appears to work fine. I'll post an update when I go to ...
customer_reviews.text: This fit my 2014 S1000RR without a problem and appears to work fine. I'll post an update when I go to take it off with the next oil change to let you know how the nut on the end of it works to help remove the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Rebs

customer_reviews.title: K&N does it again.
customer_reviews.text: K&N is a well-known and reputable maker of filters for all sorts of vehicles. This nifty motorcycle oil filer is great, for the following reasons: - Because K&N! - Integral nub for a socket. No more oil filter wrench heads! - Includes a safety wire hole for racers. Nice thought
customer_reviews.author: GearHead

customer_reviews.title: Good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install- More important easier to remove , better then OEM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality at good price
customer_reviews.text: Switched to K&N on advice of friends. Have used in BMW K1200RS & R1200GS and have been very pleased. Easy on/off is much appreciated. Avoided having to buy another "special" BMW oil filter "wrench" for $45 when I bought the R1200GS. Excellent filtration. Will continue to use and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JOB

customer_reviews.title: Good filter, but you are paying for the name
customer_reviews.text: And maybe the welded nut. I mean, the nut makes it very easy to remove from the bike (I used this with a BMW K1200GT), especially when a filter wrench may not be an option when the manufacturer has poor accessibility to the filter. But its about the only advantage it has over over comparable filters.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about an oil filter...it works and the price wasn’t bad. Shipping speed was impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Satterly

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to change filter for 07 R1200GS and 02 R1150RT bikes.  Go To filter!
customer_reviews.text: Preferred filter due to nut at end allowing me to travel without an oil filter wrench, much easier to replace than standard filters. Use on both 02 R1150RT and 07 R1200GS.
customer_reviews.author: Mini Sub

customer_reviews.title: Great filters fit many BMW motorcycles.
customer_reviews.text: Use these on 2007 BMW K1200GT, 2012 R2200GS, and wife's 2013 R1200R. Great filter with good price. Can get them direct from K&N for same price.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: As far as I can tell the filter works fine. It fits correctly and is easy to remove ...
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can tell the filter works fine. It fits correctly and is easy to remove when its time to change the oil again
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Good filters
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. These are for my 2009 BMW F800ST and they fit and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy replacement for a BMW GS1200R. Removes the need for a specialty tool.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good filter but hard to get a socket not to strip the end bolt
customer_reviews.text: Good filter but hard to get a socket not to strip the end bolt. Can't complain about performance of the filter though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter for 2012 BMW R1200RT
customer_reviews.text: My preferred oil filter for my 2012 BMW R1200 RT. Good quality and I like the bolt on the bottom for easy on and off. Great price, much cheaper than the BMW brand filter and in my opinion just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Dori

customer_reviews.title: That safety wire ready nut on the bottom is worth ...
customer_reviews.text: That safety wire ready nut on the bottom is worth the extra few bucks. The filter can be changed on the road without having to use a bulky filter wrench. The safety wire hole.....in case I go to Bonneville.
customer_reviews.author: SavannahCapt

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for OEM
customer_reviews.text: I use these K&N filters instead of the OEM version because I don't want to buy a special tool and the generic strap/band tools are tough to use on my BMW. The hex on the bottom make it simple to change the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter is less expensive than the BMW filter and is backed by K&N. I have used thier products for many years on different vehicles and I have never been dissapointed by price or quality. You can use a standard size socket or wrench to remove this filter so you do not need to purchase a special tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This says it fit my motorcycle but it didn't tread ...
customer_reviews.text: This says it fit my motorcycle but it didn't thread on. I believe it was manufactured wrong and it's too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Top nut makes removal so much easier, cant attest ...
customer_reviews.text: Top nut makes removal so much easier, cant attest to it's performance but I've never had any filter related problems.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnmd

customer_reviews.title: The 2010 BMW F800ST oil filter replacement
customer_reviews.text: Seldom listed for 2010 BMW F800ST, but this is the one and it is less expensive here.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: These filters are the perfect fit for my 2009 BMW F800ST
customer_reviews.text: These filters are the perfect fit for my 2009 BMW F800ST. These sure beat the OEM filters by having the nut on the front, so I can easily remove it when I change my oil next time.
customer_reviews.author: Angela ChangTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Good filter,good price
customer_reviews.text: Second one I've used on my bike. Super easy to replace. Recieved it very quickly after ordering.

customer_reviews.title: check for proper fit.
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit the bmw k1600 gt/gtl. The nipple at the top of the of the filter blocks the movement of the great shifter.
customer_reviews.author: Sam p

customer_reviews.title: Love the welded nut on these filters
customer_reviews.text: Love the welded nut on these filters. I have a K1200R Sport and without that nut I need to drop my kickstand to get a strap around the filter to take it off or install it. Great products as always from K & N.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Great web site, I'm done with e-bay.....
customer_reviews.text: Every time I look for something i find it on Amazon. A great way to look up many many items. I always point Amazon to my friends and co-workers if they are looking for stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Schubkeegel

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter.
customer_reviews.text: Standard high-quality K&N filter and it was at the price I found. This one is great because it obviates the need for a oil filter strap or special BMW oil filter adapter. Well worth the $. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gl

customer_reviews.title: Have a 2008 BMW R1200GS
customer_reviews.text: I used regularly in my bike and they work fine. Don't need a special tool to take the filter off; just use a 17mm wrench. Don't forget to use a new crush washer on your drain plug!
customer_reviews.author: DYGIT

customer_reviews.title: These are better than BMW brand because they can be installed and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are better than BMW brand because they can be installed and removed without the special $45 BMW wrench. These take normal sockets.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Timanus

customer_reviews.title: Great product will continue to order more.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and works perfect for my GSA. Can't beat the price. Performance is as expected from K&N.
customer_reviews.author: Darin/Heidi

customer_reviews.title: I like the cap nut
customer_reviews.text: Dirty oil in, cleaner oil out, what's not to like? K&N is a pricy brand, probably a little more expensive than they should be, but I've never had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: MikeK

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wrong application
customer_reviews.text: Not for 2012 K1600GTL, interferes with the shifter. Good product, wrong application.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement to the OEM Filter for my 2013 BMW F800GS. Easier to put on and take off than the OEM Brand and a fraction of the cost.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: much nicer than oem filter and much easier to get on and off with a normal socket wrench.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove and replace
customer_reviews.text: K&N make excellent products. I switched to this filter because of their known reliability. Ease of use is a major factor, the nut on the top of the filter means you do not need a special filter wrench to remove or replace.

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit for my 2009 F-650 GS
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time. perfect fit for my 2009 F-650 GS Twin

customer_reviews.title: K&N at these prices?

customer_reviews.text: It fit my BMW R1200GS, 09. The best part is the nut welded on the bottom making a filter wrench unnecessary.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent replacement for BMW's OEM motorcycle filter.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this filter for K1600
customer_reviews.text: Will not work on BMW K1600GTL as stated. The nut on the end of the filter interferes with the shift lever.

customer_reviews.title: K+N Filter
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on 2005 - 2012 BMW R1200GS, easy to install great performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and really like having the hex nut for the install and removal
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Easy on and easy off.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Been using it on my 2013 BMW 700GS. The 17mm nut to take off is an excellent feature of this filter.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Will buy again, worked as need for my use. I would recommend to friends and family.. It is a great price too

customer_reviews.title: Better than OEM.
customer_reviews.text: I liked being able to get a part for my unusual HP 2 Enduro without depending on a dealer. I especially appreciate the built-in grip for a socket wrench. It's the only way to go.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2013 BMW F800GS Perfectly. Black so it matches the engine case. Filters the oil to my satisfaction.

customer_reviews.title: Top filter
customer_reviews.text: It's K&N, what can you say? Top filter and has the safety wire hole and 17mm wrenching hex as well.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It fits and is easy to remove do to the hex head
customer_reviews.author: guy1234

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for me at all- I thought the ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me at all- I thought the nut on the end would make insatallation easy- but once installed , the shifter hit it. Had to buy another without the nut on the end. Don't understand why it was rated for a BMW 1600GTL
customer_reviews.author: Paul Eisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: KNG is always great, seller shipped all items on time. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: FredM

customer_reviews.title: KN-164 Oil Filter.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only after-market oil filter made to fit my BMW R1200GS. The factory filters are very expensive and it is nice to have a less expensive choice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fauth

customer_reviews.title: Fit. Works.
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect fit for my 2008 BMW R1200RT. Particularly for models like mine, this is a worthwhile upgrade because otherwise the oil filter is very difficult to access with a wrench. Just a thin film of plastic to pop off and you're on your way. I've put about 5,000 mi on it and am quite satisfied. The rest of the world could learn something from K&N. That little nubbin on the end is seriously useful. Filter wrenches are infernal contraptions that we'd be better off without.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Kanoa Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Love the nut!
customer_reviews.text: better quality than most filters and easy to put on and off with a wrench, socket, or channel locks.
customer_reviews.author: DrDCD

customer_reviews.title: AFFORDABLE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: NUT ON THE BOTTOM MAKES IT A LIFESAVER!!!!!!! WITHOUT HE NUT ONE CAN HAVE QUITE A TIME REMOVING THE FILTER.
customer_reviews.author: FJR Rider

customer_reviews.title: KN 164 good.
customer_reviews.text: I use the KN-164 on a R1200GS motorcycle and like the fact that it has the 17mm hex cap so that it is not necessary for me to purchase yet another expensive "special" tool to install the stock (and more pricy) filter. I bought 3 at one time to save shipping cost. Lower price + better function = good!
customer_reviews.author: JohnF

customer_reviews.title: Read if fitting in BMW motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Great filter: K&N quality and superb design (ease of installation/removal) NOTE: If you are in installing this filter in an application where it is immersed in oil, either buff off the paint or purchase a filter which is unpainted. Being in hot oil will eventually take the paint off the filter and deposit within your oil pan and engine.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: K&N OIl filter BMW motorcycle Hexhead
customer_reviews.text: K & N always has made quality products. Ease of installation not needing some special filter wrench has always attracted me to the brand. Price is much better then BMW branded, which I believe is actually made by MAHLE.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Do it its job
customer_reviews.text: I used this kind of filter for 5 times (each 10K kms). This filter is easy to install. K&N are making great products.
customer_reviews.author: Ilia

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter
customer_reviews.text: Nice filter with socket for 17mm spanner. No more need to buy special tool to loose the filter.I will ve using it again for my F800GS.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Pospisil

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: K&N standard good quality. The hex head is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Upstash

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Love the hex nut for removal. No more special BMW tool!
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: Nut no fit
customer_reviews.text: Good filter. The nut will interfere with the shift lever on the 2012 K1600GT. I was able to remove it (the nut, not the lever) with a belt sander and it works fine....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer James

product_meta.title: K&N Motorcycle Oil Filter: High Performance, Premium, Designed to be used with Synthetic or Conventional Oils: Fits Select BMW Motorcycles, KN-164
product_meta.description: K&N premium oil filters for powersports vehicles utilize an innovative, highly efficient synthetic-blend filtration media designed to be compatible with synthetic, petroleum-based, and blended oils, including the high concentrations of synthetic racing oils. The heavy-duty canister is engineered to be exceptionally durable, and a 17mm welded hex nut can be used for quick and easy filter removal. Engineered to support exceptionally high flow rates while providing outstanding protection from harmful engine contaminants, each filter is specifically designed to withstand the service intervals recommended by vehicle manufacturers, and is protected by the K&N 1-Year Limited Warranty. Vehicle Fitment: 2015-2018 BMW C650 Sport; 2011-2018 BMW C650GT; 2017-2018 BMW K1600 Bagger; 2011-2018 BMW K1600GT; 2011-2018 BMW K1600GTL; 2013-2018 BMW R nine T; 2016-2018 BMW R nine T Pure; 2016-2018 BMW R nine T Racer; 2016-2018 BMW R nine T Scrambler; 2016-2018 BMW R nine T Urban GS; 2017 KYMCO AK550; 2013-2016 BMW K1600GTL Exclusive; 2011-2015 BMW C600 Sport; 2014 BMW K1600GT Sport; 2007-2014 BMW R1200R; 2005-2014 BMW R1200RT; 2005-2013 BMW R1200GS Adventure; 2004-2012 BMW R1200GS; 2011 BMW R1200R Classic; 2008-2010 BMW R1200 HP2 Sport; 2006-2009 BMW R1200S; 2007-2008 BMW HP2 Megamoto; 2005-2008 BMW R1200GS HP2; 2005-2008 BMW R1200ST
feature_bullets: HIGH FLOW RATES: Designed to provide exceptional flow rates and a consistent flow of oil to your engine
PROTECT YOUR ENGINE:  Synthetic-blend filtration media removes most harmful contaminants
EXTENSIVELY TESTED: Laboratory tested to ensure excellent capacity and burst strength
VERSATILE COMPATIBILITY: Designed to operate with all synthetic, conventional, and blended motor oils
EASY TO REMOVE: Fast and easy Wrench-Off removal
HEAVY-DUTY CONSTRUCTION: Heavy-duty canister for outstanding durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars335 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
